verb.description: Move with a smooth continuous motion, typically with little noise.
Make an unpowered flight, either in a glider or in an aircraft with engine failure.

noun.description: A sound produced as the vocal organs move toward or away from articulation of a vowel or consonant, for example /y/ in mute /myo͞ot/.

origin: Old English glīdan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch glijden and German gleiten.
